business.headline: Oxford India Forum 2025 celebrates India's rising influence, youthful ambitionThe Oxford India Forum 2025 brought together a dynamic mix of business leaders, policymakers, entrepreneurs, academics and students to reflect on India's evolving global role and the path forward.

The Great Indian Salary CrisisWhite-collar employees in India are caught in a salary spiral where costs keep climbing, pay moves slowly, and financial stability slips further away. On paper, the economy is booming, but the pay cheques of working middle-class Indians tell a very different story.
India proposes retaliatory duties at world trade body against US tariffs on autosIndia has proposed to impose an equivalent amount of duty collected from products originating in the United States.

Real Estate vs Mutual Funds: Where should you invest, explains stock market expertOwning a house was once every family's dream, but times have changed. With high prices and new ways to invest, is real estate still smart, or are mutual funds better? A stock market expert explains.

Ankur Mehra says creators must think like startups, not influencersAnkur Mehra, in his new book Pixels to Profits, urges creators to stop chasing follower counts and instead build sustainable, multi-platform businesses.

Success isn't about number of followers in creator economy: Ankur MehraIn a conversation with Business Today's Sakshi Batra, Ankur Mehra, author of Pixels to Profits, explains what it really takes to succeed in the creator economy, and why chasing viral fame or follower counts may be the wrong metric altogether.
Sensex ends 192 points higher, Nifty below 25,500; Infosys gains 1%Sensex ends 192 points higher, Nifty below 25,500; Infosys gains 1%

India tags it, West sells it. Can Prada's Kolhapuri row lead to real reform?The luxury brand's new "toe-ring sandal" has ignited not just cultural outrage but also legal action in India, with a Public Interest Litigation filed in the Bombay High Court.

Where are ITR-2 and ITR-3 forms? Why they're missing and what to doIt's ITR season but many taxpayers can't find the ITR-2 and ITR-3 forms on the Income Tax portal yet. If you have capital gains, foreign income or business income, this delay might worry you. The good news is there's an extended deadline this year. Here's why these forms are missing and what you should do next.

SBI credit card rules changing from July 15: Here's what cardholders must knowAt present, many cardholders pay only a small part of their bill to avoid late charges. But now, the way the minimum amount due (MAD) is calculated will change starting July 15, 2025.

One in 4 Indians still below minimum standard of living: World BankDespite a sharp drop in extreme poverty, about one in four Indians still falls below the level needed to meet essential needs and maintain a minimum standard of living.

Sebi bans Jane Street for stock market manipulation. Here's what went wrongUS Trading Firm Jane Street: Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) said the trades executed by the group were "prima facie fraudulent and manipulative" and violated the country's capital market regulations.

Want Rs 36 lakh in 5 years? Know who can avail this government schemeThis government scheme offers guaranteed returns, so you don't have to worry about market ups and downs. For the current quarter, the interest rate is fixed at 7.7% per year.

Why did Soham Parekh work multiple jobs? Indian techie shares his reasonsHe confirmed that he worked at several companies simultaneously and misrepresented his location and employment status in the process.

Gold gathering dust in locker? Financial advisor explains how to make it workA financial advisor has warned that family gold stored in lockers faces risk from rust, floods, and poor insurance. He explains how a scheme can offer safety and steady returns instead.

EPF, NPS can build Rs 12 crore retirement fund. Tax expert breaks it downFor salaried individuals earning up to Rs 14.65 lakh annually, Bangar believes this combination offers the best of both worlds: zero tax under the new regime and long-term wealth creation.
Sensex opens 82 points higher, Nifty below 25,500; Bajaj Finance up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 46.97 points to 83,286.44, while the NSE Nifty50 added 14.45 points to 25,419.75 as of 9:22 am.

HCLTech joins hands with OpenAI to take AI to businessesThe collaboration aims to help global companies adopt AI at scale, combining HCLTech's industry experience with OpenAI's advanced AI models and tools.

Global trading firm Jane Street banned by Sebi from securities marketAccording to an order published on Sebi's website, the regulator has ordered the seizure of Rs 48.4 billion (approximately $570 million), which it claims is the total amount of illegal profit made by Jane Street.

DA hike July 2025: 4% increase likely for central government employeesDearness Allowance is revised twice a year, in January and July. It is based on the average of All India Consumer Price Index for Industrial Workers (AICPI-IW) data over the past 12 months.

Nvidia to become world's most valued company ever with $3.9 trillion market capNvidia is set to become the most valuable company ever, reaching a $3.92 trillion market cap amid soaring AI demand. Its dominance in AI chipmaking has fuelled rapid growth, outpacing rivals like Apple and Microsoft.

IndiGo appoints former NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant as non-executive directorIndiGo has appointed former NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant as a Non-Executive Director on its board, pending regulatory and shareholder approvals.

RBI bars foreclosure charges on floating rate loans to micro, small businessesAccording to the new rules, no prepayment charges will be allowed on floating rate loans to MSEs or to individuals borrowing for business purposes.

How poor is 'poor' in India?Millions of Indians have exited extreme poverty, yet many still live one crisis away from hunger, debt, or despair. In this deep dive, we examine why poverty is retreating in numbers, but not in reality.

Meesho files confidential papers for IPO to raise Rs 4,250 crore: ReportMeesho is a well-known player in India's booming e-commerce space, taking on giants like Amazon and Flipkart, with big global investors such as Prosus, Elevation Capital, WestBridge Capital, SoftBank, and Peak XV Partners backing it.
Sensex settles 170 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; Maruti down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 170.22 points to end at 83,239.47, while the NSE Nifty50 fell by 48,10 points to close at 25,405.30.

Don't set and forget: Why your SIPs need regular check-upsWhile the idea of 'set it and forget it' may seem peaceful, doing so could lead to long-term underperformance, missed opportunities, or even a shortfall in your retirement goals.

Zerodha's Nithin Kamath cautions investors against risks in unlisted sharesNithin Kamath said that many people get carried away by the hype around buying shares of companies before they go public. But in reality, unlisted shares are risky and can leave investors stuck without a way to sell.

Has the oil market grown numb to conflict in the Middle East?Global oil demand growth in 2025 is on track to be just 870,000 barrels per day. This would make it the weakest year for oil demand since 2001, except during major economic disruptions like the 2008 financial crisis and the COVID-19 pandemic.

India's income inequality now worse than British era, says financial analystThe divide between India's rich and poor is bigger than ever, with almost half the people surviving on very little, while a privileged few hold most of the wealth, says Hardik Joshi, a financial analyst.

HDFC Bank CEO moves Supreme Court against Lilavati Hospital FIRThe clash between one of India's largest private banks and a big Mumbai hospital is linked to a financial transaction, but the exact details of the FIR or the amount involved were not shared in court.

Lost your ITR login? Here's how to file income tax using net bankingIf you can't remember your Income Tax portal password, you don't need to reset it straight away. Most major banks in India allow you to access the e-Filing portal through their net banking services. It's a safe and easy way to file your return on time.

Axis Bank, Nestle India set dividend record dates; last day to buy shares todayNestle India and Axis Bank have fixed July 4 as the record date, which will decide who is eligible to receive the dividend payouts.

The quiet Chinese game to disrupt iPhone production in IndiaThe latest model, the iPhone 17, was to be a huge step in Apple's plans to make India its second home for high-end production. That roadmap now looks uncertain as Foxconn has pulled out Chinese staff.

Who is Soham Parekh, Indian techie who worked at 4-5 US startups at same time?Soham Parekh, who is believed to be based in India, is alleged to have simultaneously worked at up to four or five startups—many of them backed by Y Combinator—raising questions about hiring practices in remote-first tech culture.
Sensex, Nifty struggle for direction as markets await India-US deal newsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 13.01 points to 83,396.68, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 3.70 points to 25,449.70 as of 9:29 am.
Will Sensex, Nifty open higher amid US–Vietnam trade deal impact?Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,584 points at 8:18 am, suggesting an increase from the previous close of 25,574.50.

Stocks to watch on July 3: Nykaa, RVNL, Nestle, Yes Bank, Dmart, PNBInvestors are now watching company announcements for the April–June quarter results, while developments related to a possible trade deal between India and the United States are also being closely followed.

Retiring without children? Here's how to plan for a comfortable and secure futureToday, more and more Indians are choosing to remain child-free or find themselves without direct heirs for various reasons. For them, retirement planning isn't just about saving money and building a corpus, it's about securing comfort, care, dignity, and independence in their golden years.

Sensex ends 288 points lower, Nifty settles below 25, 500; Tata Steel down 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 287.60 points to end at 83,409.69, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 88.40 points to end at 25,453.40.

entertainment.headline: Kajol on Ajay Devgn's clash with YRF over Son of Sardaar: I felt helplessActor Kajol recently recalled how Ajay Devgn's clash with Yash Raj Films over 'Son of Sardaar' (2012) release impacted her. She opened up on how she dealt with it as someone connected to both Ajay and Aditya Chopra.

Ranveer Singh wipes his Instagram feed clean a day before birthday, builds intrigueIn a surprising move, actor Ranveer Singh has cleared his Instagram feed a day before his 40th birthday. This sudden move has left fans speculating the reason behind the same.

Anushka Shetty's Ghaati release gets postponed again, producers issue statementThe release date of actor Anushka Shetty's action-drama 'Ghaati' has been postponed yet again. The producers confirmed the same in an official statement.

Kajol on paparazzi culture: Nysa was too young when paps began chasing herKajol, in a recent interview, opened up about the constant glare of paparazzi and how she's guided her children, Nysa and Yug, to cope with it.

Vijay Sethupathi apologises over son Surya's viral video: May be unintentionalVijay Sethupathi addressed a recent controversy involving his son Surya at the 'Phoenix' premiere. He offered his clarification on the matter and also apologised to people who were hurt in case of misunderstandings.

Freida Pinto backs Deepika's spot on Hollywood Walk of Fame: No need for debateActor Freida Pinto recently reacted to Deepika Padukone being named as one of the honouries on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. She slammed the criticism over the same and asked people to take pride in celebrating the South Asian community.

Naseeruddin Shah says post backing Diljit Dosanjh was taken down by FacebookVeteran actor Naseeruddin Shah recently revealed that his post supporting Diljit Dosanjh amid the 'Sardaar Ji 3' controversy was taken down by Facebook. Shah had earlier shared a strong statement backing the Punjabi actor-singer for proceeding with the release of his film despite the backlash.

Sona Mohapatra on Kaanta Laga row, questions paid PR and milking Shefali's deathSinger Sona Mohapatra reacted to the backlash after her post calling out 'Kaanta Laga' makers. She had slammed the creators of the track for passing off the song as theirs.

Nick kisses Priyanka, enjoys fireworks as they celebrate 4th of July in New YorkNick Jonas and Priyanka Chopra had a great time celebrating the Fourth of July in New York. The two witnessed fireworks as they took part in the grand celebrations.

Anurag Basu shares update on Kartik Aaryan-Sreeleela film, title announcement soonDirector Anurag Basu recently shared an update on the shooting schedule of his upcoming film with Kartik Aaryan and Sreeleela. He also discussed the film's title announcement.

Why Bollywood's OTT detox might just get audience back to theatresThe exclusive screening of films in theatres has sparked industry-wide discussion about the future of cinema. While exhibitors and multiplex owners praised the move for reviving the lost glory of the big screen, some producers and trade experts remain cautious, citing the importance of OTT and satellite revenue.

Shoaib Ibrahim says Dipika Kakar's cancer can recur, treatment may take 2 yearsActor Shoaib Ibrahim recently revealed that his wife Dipika Kakar's cancer can recur after surgery. He even updated fans about her medication and further treatment.

Metro In Dino box office Day 1: Anurag Basu's film is off to a decent startFilmmaker Anurag Basu's 'Metro In Dino' boasting a star-studded cast, hit theatres on July 4. The film, which opened to rave reviews, collected Rs 3.35 crore on its opening day.

Prabhas offers Rs 50 lakh aid for actor Fish Venkat's kidney transplantActor Prabhas has promised financial assistance to veteran comedian Fish Venkat, who is currently battling for his life in the ICU and urgently needs a kidney transplant.

Actor Julian McMahon dies at 56 after long battle with cancerJulian McMahon, known for Nip/Tuck, Charmed, and Fantastic Four, has died at 56 after battling cancer. The actor was celebrated for his versatility, charisma, and beloved roles in TV and film.

Arijit Singh becomes most followed on Spotify, beats Taylor Swift and Ed SheeranArijit Singh has become the most followed artist on Spotify with 151 million followers, surpassing global stars like Taylor Swift and Ed Sheeran. Despite having fewer monthly listeners, his follower count reflects a strong and dedicated global fan base.

Spirit: Sandeep Reddy Vanga to begin shooting in September, Prabhas to join laterFilming of 'Spirit' begins in September 2025, with Prabhas to join the set in November. The actor will star alongside Triptii Dimri in the upcoming film.

Munawar Faruqui on secret wedding with Mehzabeen Coatwala: It was for my sonMunawar Faruqui shared that his decision to marry Mehzabeen Coatwala was driven by his desire to live with his son, Mikael. The wedding, kept private, happened just a month after the decision and within five months of knowing Mehzabeen.

Metro In Dino X review: Fans impressed with Sara's performance, miss Irrfan'Metro In Dino', which released in theatres today (July 4) has got social media buzzing with reviews. As per X users, actor Sara Ali Khan has delivered an impressive performance.

general news.headline: Saturday blockbuster in Mumbai ft Uddhav Thackeray and Raj. What lies aheadWhile Uddhav Thackeray and Raj said the cause of 'Marathi bhasha' and 'Marathi manoos' brought them together, the duo dropped ample hints of a political alliance.

Repair or repatriate? UK technicians to examine stranded F-35 in Kerala tomorrowA team of around 25 technicians from the UK is expected to arrive in Thiruvananthapuram on Sunday to assess the stranded F-35 fighter jet of the Royal Navy. The jet has been stranded for three weeks.

Day 4 Live: Gill enters 90 as lead goes beyond 450England (ENG) vs India (IND), 2nd Test Day 4 Live Score and Updates: Shubman Gill is continuing his rich form as he registers his third 50-plus score of the series. He and Rishabh Pant continued the onslaught after lunch, adding over 100 runs for the fourth wicket as they took the lead past 400.

NC Classic Live: Neeraj Chopra to battle for gold at homeNeeraj Chopra Classic Live Updates: The Sree Kanteerava Stadium in Bengaluru is slowly filling up. A fantastic turnout so far for India's first top-tier international javelin event. Neeraj Chopra will headline a field of 12 top-class throwers in Bengaluru today.

Tech founder reveals how Soham Parekh operated and how he fooled companiesYet another story from Soham Parekh's controversy is out. Dhruv Amin, co-founder of AI startup Create, reveals Parekh came to work only once and frequently missed meetings, and delayed deliverables.

Devendra Fadnavis's 'Thank You' jab after Raj Thackeray credits him for reunionMaharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis sarcastically thanked Raj Thackeray for crediting him with reuniting the Thackeray cousins. He mocked their rally, calling it a "rudali" speech instead of a victory celebration.

Nehal Modi, brother of fugitive Nirav Modi, arrested in US in bank fraud caseNehal Modi, a Belgian national, was taken into custody following an extradition request by India, the US Justice Department said.

Bhaiya, do something: Last message of UPSC aspirant who died in Delhi mall fireKumar Dhirender Pratap, a 25-year-old UPSC aspirant from Uttar Pradesh's Sonbhadra who had been living in Delhi for five years, died in the fire that broke out at Vishal Mega Mart in Karol Bagh.

Kajol on Ajay Devgn's clash with YRF over Son of Sardaar: I felt helplessActor Kajol recently recalled how Ajay Devgn's clash with Yash Raj Films over 'Son of Sardaar' (2012) release impacted her. She opened up on how she dealt with it as someone connected to both Ajay and Aditya Chopra.

Wimbledon Day 6 Live: Sinner wins 2nd set vs Martinez, Andreeva into Round 4Wimbledon Live Score, Day 6: Jannik Sinner has won the second set against Pedro Martinez. 18-year-old Mirra Andreeva is through to the fourth round at SW19 after beating Hailey Baptiste of the United States in straight sets.

Why Bollywood's OTT detox might just get audience back to theatresThe exclusive screening of films in theatres has sparked industry-wide discussion about the future of cinema. While exhibitors and multiplex owners praised the move for reviving the lost glory of the big screen, some producers and trade experts remain cautious, citing the importance of OTT and satellite revenue.

Hope to live for 30-40 years more: Dalai Lama on eve of 90th birthdaySpeaking at the long-life prayer ceremony ahead of his 90th birth anniversary on Sunday at Tsuglagkhang, the main Dalai Lama temple in McLeodganj, Tenzin Gyatso said that he has "clear signs and indications" that the blessings of the Avalokiteshvara are with him.

Meet Chester Greenwood, the teen who invented earmuffs and a dozen other thingsAt 15, Chester Greenwood invented earmuffs to battle the cold in Maine, US. By 18, he was a patent holder. He went on to file over "100 patents", became a hometown icon, and eventually left behind a joyful legacy still celebrated today.

We've come together to stay together: Uddhav on reunion with Raj ThackerayShiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray made statements when the two cousins reunited on Saturday to celebrate the Maharashtra government's rollback of Hindi as an optional third language.

Nehal Modi was in US jail for 3 years before arrest in PNB scam: SourcesNehal Modi, a Belgian national and the younger brother of fugitive diamond merchant Nirav Modi, was arrested for the multi-crore PNB scam. Earlier, he was recently released from a US jail after serving a three-year jail term, sources said.

BCCI defers India's Bangladesh tour in August 2025 to September 2026The BCCI (Board of Control for Cricket in India) and the BCB (Bangladesh Cricket Board) have mutually agreed to postpone the white-ball series between Bangladesh and India to September 2026.

Ranveer Singh wipes his Instagram feed clean a day before birthday, builds intrigueIn a surprising move, actor Ranveer Singh has cleared his Instagram feed a day before his 40th birthday. This sudden move has left fans speculating the reason behind the same.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Training of cops needed: Karti Chidambaram on Tamil Nadu custodial deathReacting to the autopsy report of a Tamil Nadu temple security guard who died allegedly in police custody last month, Congress MP Karti Chidambaram said it was gravely distressing and called for sensitisation of police forces.

Man comes home drunk, wife beats him to death with ragi rolling pin in BengaluruThe woman confessed that she used a wooden cooking stick typically used to make ragi mudde (millet balls) to beat her husband after he came home intoxicated.

The Great Indian Salary CrisisWhite-collar employees in India are caught in a salary spiral where costs keep climbing, pay moves slowly, and financial stability slips further away. On paper, the economy is booming, but the pay cheques of working middle-class Indians tell a very different story.

Pahalgam attack unfortunate, India used it to destabilise peace, says Pak PMPakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif, referring to Operation Sindoor, accused India of destabilising regional peace through 'unprovoked and reckless' hostility towards the country.

Muslim woman's divorce victory rekindles marital-equality debateThe Telangana High Court recently upheld a Muslim woman's unilateral right to divorce through Khula, which means she does not require her husband's consent, or any religious body's approval for separation. The landmark ruling has reignited conversations around marital equality, gender justice, and the applicability of personal laws under constitutional principles.

Kolkata rape accused was made students' point of contact despite criminal recordDocuments accessed by India Today TV show that a South Calcutta Law College notice dated August 13, 2024, named Kolkata gangrape prime accused Monojit Mishra as the primary point of contact for student matters, despite facing criminal cases.

sports.headline: Nat Sciver-Brunt out of T20I series vs India Women, to return for ODIsThe England Women's skipper has been ruled out of the remaining two games of the five-match T20i series against India due to a groin injury. However, she is expected to be back for the ODI series that is to follow.

Shubman Gill joins Virat Kohli in elite England club for India Test captainsShubman Gill joined Virat Kohli in an elite list of India captains as he became the second Test skipper to score 500 runs in England. Gill got to the landmark when he scored 76 runs in the second innings of the Edgbaston Test.
Bangladesh drop Shanto for T20I series against Sri LankaBangladesh have dropped their former skipper Najmul Hossain Shanto for their upcoming T20I series against Sri Lanka to be held from July 10.

Watch: Rishabh Pant sends bat flying and leaves crowd and dressing room in splitsRishabh Pant proved to be the total entertainer at Edgbaston on Day 4 of the second Test as he sent his bat flying. The moment left the crowd and the Indian dressing room in splits, with Jasprit Bumrah struggling to hold on to his laughter.

Rishabh Pant calls Rohit Sharma 'bossy', Gautam Gambhir gives him reality checkIndia wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant recently called Rohit Sharma bossy, which sparked a hilarious response from head coach Gautam Gambhir.

Ronaldo misses Diogo Jota's funeral? Fans left fuming at Portugal captainCristiano Ronaldo's reported absence from the funeral of his fellow Portuguese teammate, Diogo Jota has left fans fuming at the national team captain.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi scripts history again: Hits fastest 100 in Youth ODIs14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi continues to stun the cricketing world, smashing a 52-ball century against England U19 to break the Youth ODI record — adding to his growing list of jaw-dropping achievements.

Government's stance for OCI players a positive statement of intent: ChaubeyAIFF president Kalyan Chaubey welcomed the government's new policy allowing Indian-origin players abroad to represent India. This move aims to boost the national football team's performance amid existing legal and regulatory challenges.

Arshdeep's cheeky troll of Siraj: I believe in myself and Jassi bhaiMohammed Siraj took six wickets to revive India in the second Test against England. Arshdeep Singh added humour with a cheeky remark at the end of the day's play.

Harry Brook says Leeds duck sparked hunger for Edgbaston 100After a golden duck and a painful 99 in Leeds, Harry Brook roared back with a brilliant 158 at Edgbaston, reviving England's hopes alongside Jamie Smith after a top-order collapse against India.

NC Classic: How rare is a 90m throw and can Neeraj Chopra do it at home?Neeraj Chopra returns home for the historic NC Classic in Bengaluru, where all eyes are on whether he can replicate his rare 90m throw in front of a home crowd. 90m throws are exceptional: only 1.6 percentage of the top 8001 recorded distance are above the magical mark.

Neeraj Chopra and my story are the same: Kenyan javelin greatLegendary Kenyan athlete Julius Yego is in Bengaluru to compete in the Neeraj Chopra classic. Yego, in an exclusive interview says that his and Neeraj's journies are the same.

Wimbledon Day 6 schedule: Sinner, Djokovic eye Round 3 wins on Centre CourtJannik Sinner and Novak Djokovic return to Centre Court on Day 6, looking to book their spots in the fourth round as the Wimbledon 2025 draw continues to deliver high-stakes matchups and rising tension.

Julius Yego Interview: From Kenya to Bengaluru, for javelin and friendshipSpeaking to IndiaToday.in, former world champion and Olympic silver medallist Julius Yego reflects on the significance of the Neeraj Chopra Classic for India and the global javelin community. The 36-year-old 'YouTube Man' of javelin is still going strong and sets his sights on a fifth Olympic appearance at Los Angeles 2028.

2nd Test: Jayden Seales balances scales after Australia dominate Day 2Jayden Seales dismantled Australia's top order early in the second innings of the Grenada Test. His bowling gave West Indies a crucial chance of surviving in this Test match.

England edge India in final-ball thriller to keep T20I series aliveEngland Women held their nerve in a last-ball thriller to edge out India by five runs, pulling one back in the T20I series after a dramatic collapse and a disciplined bowling comeback at The Oval.

Super Mohammed Siraj steps up and becomes India's pace leader in Bumrah's absenceMohammed Siraj stepped up in the absence of Jasprit Bumrah to deliver a stunning performance during the first innings of the Edgbaston Test against England. Coming into the game as a man with a plan and a point to prove, Siraj just stuck to his basics to rattle the English batting lineup.

Sabalenka avoids high-profile exodus, douses Raducanu's fire in Round 3Top seed Aryna Sabalenka survived a fierce battle against Emma Raducanu to enter Round 4 at Wimbledon 2025. The match showcased intense competition and left the crowd electrified with drama and remarkable tennis.

What's the buzz about Neeraj Chopra Classic? A historic first for Indian sportThe Neeraj Chopra Classic marks a historic milestone as Bengaluru hosts its first-ever top-tier athletics meet, headlined and organised by Olympic champion Neeraj Chopra. With a star-studded field and global attention, the inaugural edition of NC Classic promises to be a spectacle. Here's what we know about the event, scheduled for July 5 in Bengaluru.

Neves, Cancelo fight off tears while observing silence for Diogo JotaAl Hilal players paid emotional tribute to Diogo Jota before their Club World Cup quarterfinal. Joao Cancelo and Ruben Neves were seen fighting off tears ahead of the game.

You might not know the talent in you: Akash Deep on Gautam Gambhir's hype messageAkash Deep revealed the motivational message he got from India coach Gautam Gambhir after his stunning performance in the Edgbaston Test. Akash, along with Mohammed Siraj, helped India secure a big lead.

Gukesh gives hilarious shoutout to cousin after win over CarlsenIndian grandmaster D Gukesh clinched the rapid title at the Grand Chess Tour Zagreb by defeating Magnus Carlsen. In a hilarious interview, Gukesh revealed that one of his cousins was very upset with him.

Mohammed Siraj relishing responsibility of leading pace attack in Bumrah's absenceIndia fast bowler Mohammed Siraj revealed that he's relishing the challenge of leading India's pace attack in the absence of Jasprit Bumrah in the second Test against England at Edgbaston, Birmingham.

England confident of triggering India collapse to stage comeback: BrookEngland batter Harry Brook has revealed that they're banking on India's collapse on Day 4 to make a comeback into the second Test at Edgbaston, Birmingham.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
